website_summaries.verdict: Good ones are great, but there have been quality control issues. Not cheap.
pros: Left-side blade claimed to improve cut line visibility

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace a 30 year old saw. Wanted left sided cut. This saw is a great value at $100. I have a Bosch jig saw, very happy with that as well. This circular saw is well made. The blade wrench is included and mounted in a bracket on the saw, which is very handy. The power switch is an "over center design", so you have to initially press a bit harder, then it turns on saw, and holding pressure is light. Much better than having to press a separate safety button. More powerful than the saw I replaced. I would buy this saw again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw because I wanted the left hand blade that you traditionally get with trim saws but I wanted a framing size. My first impressions when opening the box was that there were some small chips out of the plate and some scuffs on the housing. I was not thrilled but this does not affect the performance of the saw, which is quit well. I just ripped some mdf to try it out and it was great. I have a big deck job coming up and will put the saw though it paces. Overall a pretty good saw for the money and if you want a left hand framer without buying a worm drive saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Left handed tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for my father who is left handed. He told me he loves it and it works great and saw dust doesn’t slap him in the face anymore. Since I’ve never actually used one of these, I’m sorry I can’t be more specific. What I can tell is, finding tools for left handers is hard and my father was thankful for the gift and has already used it may times since getting it this last Christmas (2019)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda P.

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in the blade depth locking mechanism and the baseplate ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in the blade depth locking mechanism and the baseplate as well with it's curved bottom edge making it hard to run against a thin straight edge. Because of the locking mechanism there's no strength between the saw and the base. Loved my left handed Porter Cable much better but couldn't find one. I own many quality Bosch tools but this one is not in their league.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - very smooth operation
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. Right out of the box it was calibrated correctly. Tons of power for the cutting I am doing while building a pole barn. I added diablo blades to my order and am very happy I did. Because I am a little ambidextrous, I get the benefit of seeing the pros and cons of both hands; right handed you see the blade very clearly but as mentioned in other comments, the sawdust shoots right out at you left handed is a very clean and smooth operation but you have to look over the motor to see the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Witt-Man

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a very good saw, but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the CS5 Circular Saw in May of 2015, and after two months of sporadic use the carbon brushes and armature needed to be replaced. It was repaired -- under warranty -- at the Bosch service facility in Anaheim, California. After another two months of normal / typical use, the carbon brushes and armature need to be replaced again. WTF? Is there an issue with the quality of the components Bosch uses for this particular saw? For five months of ownership and use, I expected something a bit more reliable. Not many choices for blade-left circular saws that are affordable, so I'll get this CS5 fixed again while it's under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Moloch667

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad base of saw.
customer_reviews.text: A totally disappointing tool from Bosch. The base is of similar strength and quality to flattened beer cans and because it's a rolled edge, it rolls up and over a straight edge. Any quality the saw would have is ruined by an inability to use it consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it will cut very nicely. However
customer_reviews.text: This thing does spin fast and when you put the right blade on it, it will cut very nicely. However, when you're finished with your cut and you take your finger off the trigger, this thing would coast it self half way around the world before it would stop. It does have a brake that you can push with your thumb but it's rather obnoxious. One other thing, I was a little more aggressive than I would've normally been when putting it on the ground (full hands) one time, and it actually bent the plate that slides along the wood. That was extremely disappointing because it's a tool, these kinds of things happen but for it to bend so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Really bad footplate
customer_reviews.text: Great design, soft start. I dont really care for the bevel adjuster. Its not very accurate at all. Its as good as was on my 15 year old skilsaw which wasnt very good from day one. For cutting studs it should be ok but would require a lot of careful adjusting for more precise work. Too bad so few circular saws made for right handed people. Update: after using it for a year i can say the footplate is a total junk. It flexes, doesn't lock and doesn't keep right angle.
customer_reviews.author: ValVe

customer_reviews.title: Bosch circular saw, left side blade
customer_reviews.text: I have and use many Bosch tools as a professional carpenter and part time bow builder. This new addition to my shop did not disappoint. I was thinking it would have a smaller, less powerful motor for a $100 saw. Nope, it has a nice heavy duty motor, and functions like I would expect coming from Bosch. The left side blade works great for me having used Skill 77 worm drive for over 30 years. Cuts wood and makes sawdust, what more could a guy want for the price !
customer_reviews.author: David Lynch

customer_reviews.title: comfortable but not durable
customer_reviews.text: Im a framing contractor and this is a really ergonomic saw but they just don't last, Im onto my third saw already. I keep buying them because theyre nicely priced and the older guys like to cut rafters with it. The main bearing literally rips apart in these saws only after months of use. maybe theyre good for a homeowner but for day in and day out framing they don't last
customer_reviews.author: Charles Gravel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 👏🏼
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift! The person whom I purchased this item for, stated that this was the BEST hand saw! Plus with the sale and additional blades as an add on, this was obviously a no brainer!
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: I would buy more!
customer_reviews.text: I use this saw for everyday use on a framing crew and it works great!! It has a wide base for very steady accurate cuts. It flies through half inch OSB like a rocket! It works great on all other wood materials, cuts straight as the user can, I used this to dry cut lines in a concrete garage and it handled it like a champ, although when i cut about 90 feet back to back in cement it burnt up on me:( I told amazon and in two days I had a brand new saw!!! Great product, will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.B3burl

customer_reviews.title: Bad saw for right handers.
customer_reviews.text: I’m right handed. The saw exits the dust on its left side. I get saw dust blowing all over me. I don’t use the saw. Too dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Nailbender

customer_reviews.title: surprised
customer_reviews.text: I used the saw under 10 times and the brushes are already burned out. What happened BOSCH? this is not like you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Must have
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw. Right side blade works for me as I can see the cut better. Still as new after multiple projects on the house.
customer_reviews.author: DavidlyYeti575

customer_reviews.title: Left bladed convenience!
customer_reviews.text: Until you've used one, you don't realize how much nicer a left-bladed saw is (that is if you're right-handed)! Can actually see what you're cutting--safer and more accurate. Downsides (sometimes sawdust flying at you) are minor in comparison to the convenience of it. This one is powerful enough and relatively light-weight (another must) in addition to being left-bladed and reasonably priced. Perfect for the handiman user, altho my brother (a contractor) prefers the same for many of his smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Sue

customer_reviews.title: Yay it’s left handed!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a lefty. Had one of these several years ago, it “disappeared” from my garage. Nice to have it back. Thanks loads.
customer_reviews.author: Tigertiger

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a hobbyist on a budget. I needed one saw that I could use for practically everything. I'm right-handed and this worked perfectly for me! The only downside I can think of is that the sawdust ends up all over your clothes if you're right-handed but I'm okay with that. Definitely 5/5!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Why have a second circular saw, just because :)
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a dream to use. Must have for fine cuts. Not as robust as it's big brother but still powerful.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good saw. I bought it because of the left handed blade. It's kinda important to see what I'm cutting. At 15amps it has plenty of power. No safety crap just a good saw. Bosch makes good tools.
customer_reviews.author: William Mcchesney

customer_reviews.title: Bosch CS5 120-Volt
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I bought this Bosch CS5 on December and pair it with my Freud D0760X Diablo Ultra Finish Saw Blade that I purchased here too and wow. All I can say about this machine is perfection, is strong and very accurate. It cuts through 2x4 and 2x6 like butter. I'm right handed and I think this is much better than the right handed ones. The only cons is that it came with no case and it is kind of noisy but hey, better to hear the power on this monster that to have a wimpy quiet one right? ^_^ Buy it, you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: ICe

customer_reviews.title: Saw fine but no proper rip fence
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the saw a short time but fine it quite satisfactory, particularly the direct line of sight to where I'm cutting. I'm surprised/disappointed that a company like Bosch doesn't make a rip fence for it...even checked their official web site. Their recommendation, and Amazon's, is to purchase a Skill rip fence, which I did. It doesn't fit properly as it's about half the width of the slots in the saw and the screw has a different thread than the the hole in the saw base plate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I hated having to look over the motor to see my ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I had bought this saw 10 years ago. I hated having to look over the motor to see my cut line. I use this circular saw much more than my old one, simply because of the ease seeing what I'm cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Drayton Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I put a Freud 40 pt blade on it, put in my earplugs and started to cut some pine. It was so quiet that I stopped cutting and checked my work to be sure that I had the rip fence set right and the saw was going through the wood. It was set right and the saw went through the pine like a hot knife through butter. Its great to be able to see your work (I am right-handed), but you have to remember to keep your left hand away from the work!!! Best to keep it on the front handgrip.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Sweet cutting saw
customer_reviews.text: My first new circular saw in twenty years is a delight. I was leery of the left-side blade but now I wd hate to use anything else. I had a question and called Bosch customer service. Got a real person, US based, almost immediately who easily answered my question so besides giving the saw five stars I rate customer service five star, too. Thanks to the reviewers who wrote of the benefits of having the blade on the left.
customer_reviews.author: Goatsbeard

customer_reviews.title: My New Bosch
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, Bosch continues to produce a fine product that does exactly what it says it will do...and better. I especially wanted this left-sided blade and being able to see the line and the cut, even with the right side not supported, still makes it a good design. I also appreciated the adjusting levers and the measure scale for adjusting the depth of the cut. It cuts like a hot knife through warm butter...smoooth. I just line up the cut, slap the speed square down and away she goes. I was suprised to see that this quality came out of China, but maybe they are coming around the corner.
customer_reviews.author: T. W. Bent

customer_reviews.title: love this saw!
customer_reviews.text: This really us the perfect circular saw. I love how the motor is on the right. This allows for much more accurate cuts in my opinion because you can accurately align your mark using your left hand to hold a speed square and have at it. The power is more than enough for any stock I've thrown at it. Only downside is the lack of a case, but those can be had pretty cheap these days.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: A Powerful Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting to replace my 40 year old B & D saw and thought I would try a saw with the blade to the left of the motor. Most of the battery powered saws are configured this way, but there are just a few corded saws, including the worm-drive models. Since I'm a right-hander, I find the blade lines up very well for me and I don't have to lean across the saw to see what I'm cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Morning Edition Listener

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice copy of the Skil 5510 5.5 inch pro model, blade left sweetheart. Have had the Skil for 20+ years so was curious to see how the Bosch would compare. Love it. Smooth Cuts,Good blade visability,Plenty of power.One of the only blade left circular saws out there unless you want the worm drive wrist twisters at 160 bucks+. Very Happy with the saw and would recommend it to anyone looking for top performance and value.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Probably slightly more dangerous because the saw blade will be on your body side but make sure that gaurd goes down and youre fi
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little getting used to but i prefer the left blade now. Probably slightly more dangerous because the saw blade will be on your body side but make sure that gaurd goes down and youre fine.
customer_reviews.author: Stogie

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw!!
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. I wish I had it years ago. The left hand blade is a great improvement both in visibility and handling ease. So far I have not managed to fill my pockets or tool belt with sawdust. It seems rugged and well built with plenty of power. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great utility saw at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: windbag

customer_reviews.title: Smooth bearings and great quality saw.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely smooth bearings. Quality ball bearing “right-handed” saws are becoming increasingly hard to find. This may be the smoothest running, positive feeling saw I’ve ever owned, and I have worn out a ton of circular saws.
customer_reviews.author: Range Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: This Bosch saw replaced a cheap circular saw that I had for years. It is powerful and the accompaning blade is very nice quality. Have used it numerous times since I received it cutting plywood, hardwood and MDF. It has performed perfectly and, as usual, I am impressed with another quality Bosch product.
customer_reviews.author: Lutzboater

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Ok...Ok.....so the saw kicks dust in your tool pouch. As a contractor, I like to see the blade when I work. I thought about a worm-drive saw yet the weight or price didn't work for me, although the long term reliability may offset this. My history with Bosch goes way back with automobile products and I currently own several Bosch woodworking products, I believe the quality is on par or better than many of the popular makes out there. Another plus is on a job site, no one else has the same tools as I do.
customer_reviews.author: JakeZ4

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tool because I like left blade circular saws. I was the only one to regularly use it so it was not job site abused by a helper. I did not even get a 30 days of work out of it until it started arcing at the brushes and making bad noises while becoming under powered. Chinese junk.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great saw. Heavy for single handed cutting but doable
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Heavy for single handed cutting but doable. Plenty of power with room to spare for general home use. Built tough, built to last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm right-handed, but I can see what I'm doing with this saw. I've only used this a little bit, but one of those cuts was cutting a 4'x8' sheet of plywood in half and I had no problems. Don't need that gimmicky laser because I can see exactly what I'm cutting without it!
customer_reviews.author: Steve dK

customer_reviews.title: One of a very few
customer_reviews.text: One of few I like this left blade design Much better view of the cutting line 15 amps plenty of power Great saw
customer_reviews.author: DMFJ

customer_reviews.title: A great saw!
customer_reviews.text: A great saw with plenty of power for any construction work. The left-side blade is a great feature. Good sight-line, nice size, and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: A1 saw with minor annoyance
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast. Packaging was great. Was a delight to have the motor on the right side so I could see the saw cut line easily. Only drawback was the sawdust chute has no deflector and apparently no option for one; therefore, you do get a lot of sawdust on yourself. Besides that, this saw is great and met my needs. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NMBaldy

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Been looking for at left blade circular ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Been looking for at left blade circular saw for a while. To use to my cordless one to change. I mean wormdrives are this way. I like it, everything is metal on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Right Handed Saw
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my Skil Worm Drive Saw. I am used to seeing the blade when I cut and wanted a lighter weight saw that would let me do this. I have used it to frame my wood shop and am quite satisfied. Yep, it will fill your shoes with sawdust!
customer_reviews.author: TKC

customer_reviews.title: The plate on this saw absolutely sucks. I have been a carpenter for 13 years ...
customer_reviews.text: The plate on this saw absolutely sucks. I have been a carpenter for 13 years and this is cheapest plate I have ever seen. The plate has bent at multiple points and has never been dropped. Definitely not what I expected from Bosch.
customer_reviews.author: michael hebert

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for the money. Only complaint is there is no saw blade brake but to upgrade to a Milwaukee with one was a lot more money. Very happy with this "left hand" model. Easy transition from a cordless saw to this.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Thurber

customer_reviews.title: Not for daily use!
customer_reviews.text: So day #34 I am using this saw and the motor burns out on it. So if you want to know what it feels like to roast $115. Buy this saw.
customer_reviews.author: John Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Circular Saw
customer_reviews.text: this is my first left hand circular saw and it is very nice. i have used alot of saws the last 20 years (milwaukee,makita,dewalt,etc) and this one is up towards the top. it is lightweight and has plenty of power. the base is solid and flat. easy thumb lock adjustments. for you guys wanting to try out a l/h saw this is an excellent choice. i didnt find any downsides to list. great saw at a great price i would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: R. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: 15 Amps of power!
customer_reviews.text: 15 Amps of power, with a smooth start up whereas some saws want to jump out of your hand on start up. Has smooth action locking levers for depth and angle adjustments. Comes with a good quality saw blade. ~ Note left hand thread on saw blade holder, made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Upchurch

customer_reviews.title: Everything I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This saw is well put together, and has plenty of power. I've been able to make very nice clean cuts, and all the adjustments work well. Only question now is whether or not it will hold up, but it is has given me no reason to question its longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Andy S

customer_reviews.title: Very good value and tool
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked using a left hand model so I can see cut line better. Tool is top quality and easy to change for angle cuts.
customer_reviews.author: robinfla

customer_reviews.title: I am right handed so it is much better to view the cutting line
customer_reviews.text: I am right handed so it is much better to view the cutting line. I dropped a star because this does not come with a Bosch carry case like my previous one and does not fit into the old case.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Maschak

customer_reviews.title: An excellent cutting solution....
customer_reviews.text: Saw motor is smooth, base is stout and easy to set but the left sided blade is the real prize here. The line of sight is excellent IMO for right-handed users, I do not know why most saws are not so configured. Only cons - no hard case and shade on the loud side.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great tool and a great price.. If you like to cut right handed then you will love the blade being on the left line of site. LOVE IT !!!!
customer_reviews.author: THE LAST STAND

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: It only took a couple of cuts, before I was able to confirm that I had made the "right" decision purchasing this "left" bladed saw! So much easier seeing/following the cut line.
customer_reviews.author: RayBob

customer_reviews.title: Blade is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Saw is awesome. I used to use wormdrive saws (skill) before I ended up in a wheelchair. Most of the time I use a cordless saw because it's light weight. But as Tim Allen said sometimes you need "more power". This saw is heavy, but solid i'm very impressed with the quality. The blade would make a safer frisbie than a saw blade. Be sure to get a quality carbide blade.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Nedela

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, precise, and very solid. The included blade is quite good, as it produces nice cuts that require very little sanding. If you are shopping for a circular saw, I highly recommend this one! It's a steal for that price, too!
customer_reviews.author: Schnagi

customer_reviews.title: and feels FANTASTIC. Used it all day building a redwood deck
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid DYI person who is concerned about the "feel" as I am about the performance. This bosh has plenty of power, and feels FANTASTIC. Used it all day building a redwood deck, had no issues what so ever! If I had a choice to buy it again, I would! I can't say that about every tool I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Q.

customer_reviews.title: I never saw this coming
customer_reviews.text: I have been in construction for 20+ years and have used many circular saws. This saw has more than exceeded my expectations and is one of the smoothest operating saws that I have used. It's extremely powerful. The price point with Amazon was almost half of the msrp and delivery was prompt to say the say the least. I could not be happier with my tool and purchasing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Winton

customer_reviews.title: Bosch 120 Volt Circular Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, and even more wonderful because I can see what I am cutting, as I cut. Handles nice, cuts straight and true.
customer_reviews.author: T Dix

customer_reviews.title: Left hand saw
customer_reviews.text: Well made with adjustments for correct angle and depth, my old one was off about 3 degrees with no adjustment, and I especially like the left hand blade I can see my cut without leaning across the saw, I like the trigger too. Nice powerfull saw.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The saw has been working wonderful for well over a year
customer_reviews.text: The saw has been working wonderful for well over a year. Nice heavy duty saw for handy work around the house. For the price this is one of the best reviewed saw available.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wentworth

customer_reviews.title: saw-tastic
customer_reviews.text: I'm more of an amateur hobby wood worker, but for my needs this is a great saw. I bought a slab of spalted maple 2-1/4 inch thick and had to make a cut 3 feet long. The saw did this with no problems! I am very pleased and have no complaints
customer_reviews.author: happymanatee

customer_reviews.title: Looked like box was already open
customer_reviews.text: Received it broken. Looked like box was already open , not all necessary parts are included. Wasted my money and time
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Very good saw and the blade cut great and lasted longer ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good saw and the blade cut great and lasted longer than I expected. I really like using this saw..
customer_reviews.author: T. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw! Been looking forever for a corded right ...
customer_reviews.text: Great saw! Been looking forever for a corded right hand circular saw, No more looking over the top of the saw to see where its cutting.
customer_reviews.author: JCRBME

customer_reviews.title: Excellent powerful saw
customer_reviews.text: Cuts as good or better than any other circular saw I have owned. The blade on the left gives better visibility for right handers. It does throw a lot of sawdust back at the right handers. I am really glad I chose this saw.
customer_reviews.author: George0135

customer_reviews.title: Bosch CS5 Right Handed Saw.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. As a righty I was tired of the saws with the blade on the right hand side. This was exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: CountryLogic

customer_reviews.title: Okay.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, but it's a bit on the heavy side.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Mullis

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This saw burned out after two months of carpentry work. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: P Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good saw. Powerful and comes with a long power cord.
customer_reviews.author: BIOYA1

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great, as described, would recommend this product for the price
customer_reviews.author: Richard & Tammy

customer_reviews.title: This thing glides like a razor
customer_reviews.text: This thing glides like a razor. Love the ability to tilt it to cut an angle on the left side instead of a common right angle on most other saws
customer_reviews.author: Jack in MS

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great Bosch quality and after many years using a right-hand saw this is great with a line of sight that makes cuts easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph D

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this saw it's piece of crap burns in less than a month
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: what I sent for
customer_reviews.text: personally never used yet but nephew that helps me out has and it did all the cutting toisntall a newdoor last fall. and he is a lefty.Iwanted it so I could see the cut on the line better.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Gallant

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a powerful saw with a left blade design. This fits the bill perfectly. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is how the saw dust can have a tendency to be blown in your face.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: This is a great saw, I can follow my chalk line without ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw, I can follow my chalk line without stopping for a strait cut. Plenty of power to cut thru hardwoods. Sawdust blown away quick
customer_reviews.author: poppys kindle

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good while it worked
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good while it worked. Loved the left hand setup - you could visualize cuts quite well (I'm not left handed). It died 3 years to the date of purchase (looks like the motor is burning out). That doesn't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry B.

customer_reviews.title: Me Likey!
customer_reviews.text: I knew I'd like the blade on the left and it has surpassed my expectations. I can't tell you how good it feels to actually see where the blade is making contact with the piece. Just be sure to check the rotation arrow on the blade with the arrow on the blade guard though!
customer_reviews.author: Gin0M

customer_reviews.title: Durable, and good visibility of the cut
customer_reviews.text: Durable, plenty of power for my use, and as a right-hander with a dominant right eye, I like the left-side blade. Yes, moving the blade from the right to left side of the saw puts part of the body in the plane of the blade. However, being able to see what you're cutting is probably safer overall (since you may not have to contort your body as much), and certainly produces better work. I sometimes buy cheaper tools, but in this case I was happy I went with the more expensive, but very good, choice from Bosch. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: FrontRanger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is great after using the wrong sided skills for too long.
customer_reviews.author: roland green

customer_reviews.title: Bosch CS5
customer_reviews.text: Great saw and pretty good blade. This is my first left-hand saw and it makes it much better to see the cut right-handed.
customer_reviews.author: MidWest Reader

customer_reviews.title: this has been a great circular saw
customer_reviews.text: this has been a great circular saw. for trim i will only use a blade left saw, and well there just aren't any companies making blade left saws anymore
customer_reviews.author: Kristy T.

customer_reviews.title: good for right handers
customer_reviews.text: Well built, lots of capability, good for right handers. Would like to see it come with a case.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Left side.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Love the left side blade. Being right handed, I often wondered why I need to look over the saw motor to align and cut. Easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Sadler

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made saw. I wanted the left blade and this fit the bill. Only wish it had the electric brake but it's still 5 stars to me.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: The dust directional design of this saw blasts a ton ...
customer_reviews.text: The dust directional design of this saw blasts a ton of sawdust onto your legs and feet as a right handed user. It is beyond belief! I will try to ship this saw back.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: ... with the blade on the left side for a great sight line for anyone that's right handed
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight with the blade on the left side for a great sight line for anyone that's right handed.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid saw
customer_reviews.text: Good saw for the money. Hasn't given me a lick of issue since I bought it. Buy it if your on the fence. JP
customer_reviews.author: JPS1

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used this to rip and cross cut 2 pieces of plywood.It is very smooth running and powerful.I give it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Phil J.

customer_reviews.title: great saw
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a left had circular saw other than worm drive due to weight and this saw is ever bit the best circular saw I have owned
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W.

customer_reviews.title: Not for right handed
customer_reviews.text: If you're right handed, the sawdust ejection will hit you in the face, I had to cover it with tape.
customer_reviews.author: dennis toman

customer_reviews.title: This should be the last one I'll have to buy.
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for many projects including replacing my deck. I didn't realized how much I was putting up with my prior circular saw. I'd definitely recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen K. Stokes

customer_reviews.title: great saw
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked saws with a left blade and this one did not dissapoint. Easy to use and the motors power seems sufficient. Would buy again if I needed another saw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: THE PRODUCT WAS SENT IN ORIGINAL BOX PACKAGED GOOD ARRIVED IN GOOD SHAPE AND ON TIME. THE PRODUCT WAS EXACTLY AS PICTURED.
customer_reviews.author: BOO

customer_reviews.title: Good saw.
customer_reviews.text: Good saw, balance is good, plenty of power, easy adjusting, but....the sawdust exhaust is poor, blows back all over the person doing the cutting. My only poor design mark, other than that good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Flyfisher_2

customer_reviews.title: great blade on left saw
customer_reviews.text: perfect for cutting opposite cuts on rafters without having to move your work around. works great to bevel window sills too.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Sollenberger

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for men, but works as well for woman
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great. I am right handed but only like the saws with blades on left. Easy to use and handle.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good, smooth and powerful saw with blade on the right (left) side.
customer_reviews.author: Russell L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, light, and accurate cuts. Good to have on hand for those odd cuts. A Good brand and not too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Melenwick

product_meta.title: Bosch CS5 120-Volt 7-1/4-Inch Circular Saw
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Bosch CS5 120-volt 7-1/4-inch circular saw is a tool for value-conscious professionals focusing on core user needs. The lightweight CS5 delivers 15 amps of power and a left-blade design for the clearest line of sight while cutting. The anti-snag lower guard lets you make cuts without having to advance the guard, even while making bevel cuts.
feature_bullets: Features enhanced line of sight, power, and durability
